text: Alan G. MacDiarmid (April 14, 1927 â€“ February 7, 2007) was a New Zealand chemist. He received the 2000 Nobel Prize in Chemistry together with Alan Heeger and Hideki Shirakawa for "the discovery and development of conductive polymers". He was born in Masterton, New Zealand and died in Drexel Hill, Pennsylvania, United States. == References == Category:1927 births Category:2007 deaths Category:New Zealand chemists Category:New Zealand Nobel Prize winners
title: Alan MacDiarmid
